title: Vivendi to review potential change in music unit's shareholding structure
text:
May 17, 2018 / 4:37 PM / Updated 9 minutes ago Vivendi to review potential change in music unit's shareholding structure Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
PARIS (Reuters) - Vivendi ( VIV.PA ) will review a potential change in the shareholding structure of its music unit, the media giant said in a statement on Thursday. FILE PHOTO: The Vivendi logo is pictured at the main entrance of the entertainment-to-telecoms conglomerate headquarters in Paris, March 10, 2016. REUTERS/Charles Platiau/File Photo
The group also said it may request a new shareholders meeting at Telecom Italia ( TLIT.MI ), of which it owns 24 percent, in order to propose changes to the board and address what it sees as a “risk of dismantling”.
Vivendi said first-quarter sales rose 3.3 percent at constant currency and perimeter to 3.11 billion euros (2.7 billion pounds). Reporting by Mathieu Rosemain and Gwenaelle Barzic; Editing by Laurence Frost
